readings.consensus_summary: This week marked a dangerous convergence: Anthropic abandoned core safety commitments under pressure after the Pentagon branded it a national security risk, effectively demonstrating that when military priorities collide with AI safety, safety loses. Simultaneously, Block laid off nearly half its workforce explicitly because of AI, with its CEO normalizing mass displacement as an industry template—a signal that AI-driven job elimination has shifted from theoretical risk to corporate strategy. With the voluntary safety framework crumbling, economic displacement accelerating, and AI deploying into hospitals and children's lives with minimal oversight, governance is losing the race against deployment on nearly every front.
